channel.title: ...and this is why you don't Livestream Minecraft with Livestream open -__-
channel.description:
http://www.livestream.com/rip4d/video?clipId=pla_46fe5f0b-635d-44b7-985d-f7e0fdc0b5ab
The sound basically magnifies and gets louder and progressively more annoying -_- Its actually kind of odd how it happened ._. Watch if you'd like, its just me building part of my adventurecraft map.

item.title: ...and this is why you don't Livestream Minecraft with Livestream open -__-
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

I was using headphones haha. Livestream captures Windows sounds if you don’t have a microphone plugged in (which I didn’t), so it captured, streamed, captured and streamed for infinity basically. The only reason I had the window open was to see if the quality was any good, but it wasn’t until about 3/4 of the way through I remembered that my friend had told me never to do that

Read full topic
item.source: ...and this is why you don't Livestream Minecraft with Livestream open -__-

item.title: ...and this is why you don't Livestream Minecraft with Livestream open -__-
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Microphones have always done that regardless of the program you use since the first microphone. If you turn down your speakers, configure noise cancellation, or use a set of headphones that would never happen.

Read full topic
item.source: ...and this is why you don't Livestream Minecraft with Livestream open -__-
